about_the_game:
The Time Plague is a steampunk first person shooter with a great story and lots of locations to explore. You play as a journalist drawn into a mysterious world of time travel and adventure, learning to handle dangerous ray guns and other strange technology to overcome the devious Morlocks.

Play across multiple time periods on Earth and even visit far flung locations in the outer solar system, you must unravel the mysteries of the Morlock’s evil plans as they attempt to disrupt the known timeline.

Key Features:

  • Switchable VR mode. Press F12 in-game to toggle between VR and flatscreen. In VR mode, press left-control to recenter your view. 

  • Highly detailed and atmospheric scenery:
    Large and varied landscapes await the player – explore as you wish, but watch out – Morlocks and their devious technology could wait for you around every corner.
    Intelligent enemies:

  • Morlocks aren’t stupid, they’re not like dumb zombies that just stumble blindly towards you. These guys are intelligent and they fight back whilst protecting themselves when necessary.

  • Immersive storytelling
    You feel you’re part of this adventure – there are no cut scenes, you have to play your part. You don’t know what is coming next as the story unfolds around you.

name: The Time Plague Demo

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 & 11
  • Processor: Core i5-7500 / Ryzen 5 1600
  • Memory: 12 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 1060 / RX 580 - 6GB VRAM
  • VR Support: SteamVR. Valve Index, Oculus Quest 2 or 3 headsets only. Meta Quest Link or Steam Link.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 & 11
  • Processor: Core i5 11600k
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 Ti
  • VR Support: SteamVR. Valve Index, Oculus Quest 2 or 3 headsets only. Meta Quest Link or Steam Link.

short_description: The Time Plague is a steampunk first person shooter with a great story and lots of locations to explore. You play as a journalist drawn into a mysterious world of time travel and adventure, learning to handle dangerous ray guns and other strange technology to overcome the devious Morlocks.
